response.answer_text: Listening is an important part of life and while some people hear you, do they really listen? That is the most important question. If you are not in the habit of listening then we have a concern here. Listening is a form of moving forward positively and progressing towards a more humane society. Understanding what someone is going through or a perspective can really help a great deal. This is where the core value of listening resides. The art of listening is no less important than the art of communicating your message. So, here are 3 important reasons as to why people listen: To gain an understanding of a problematic situation that needs solving.To strike up a productive conversation.To connect with one another.Yes, these are the most important reasons and guess what - by simply reading my answer here, you have committed yourself to the art of listening. Let me know your opinion and we can strike up a more productive conversation. Glad to have made myself a part of this question :)

Many different reasons 1. ) First and foremost to have an effective conversation, someone must be listening in contrast to both people talking 2. ) Some people naturally are more introverted and are very natural at listening 3. ) The situation may require it like a person sharing a dramatic story or a musical concert 4) They need to get background or instructions from a colleague or expert on a particular item 5) They have a genuine interest in hearing the other person talk 6) When someone meets someone for the first time, listening is key to building trust and credibility
